text:
Alexander is a city in Rush County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 65 people lived there.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 65 people, 31 households, and 20 families living in the city.
Education.
Alexander is served by USD 395 La Crosse Public Schools.
Alexander High School was closed in 1966 through school unification. The Alexander High School mascot was Whippets.
